{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3141115,"name":"Jonathan Bacon","username":"jonathangbacon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jonathangbacon/{size}/141805_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T03:31:46.228Z","cooked":"

I am using the inbuilt autos class to reference a command group for autonomous. However when I add the options for the autos periods using SendableChooser, the program freaks out on me. Is anyone experiencing these issues?

I declared the SendableChooser with this line:

frc::SendableChooserfrc2::CommandPtr m_Chooser;

The robot fails to build when I add these two lines:

m_Chooser.SetDefaultOption( “Taxi”, autos::Kasparov(&m_Drive, &m_PoseTracker) );
m_Chooser.AddOption( “Two Ball Auto”, autos::Niemann(&m_Drive, &m_PoseTracker) );

Any advice would be greatly appreciated!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T03:40:21.237Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":30,"readers_count":29,"score":41.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":426013,"topic_slug":"does-sendablechooser-work-with-commandptr","display_username":"Jonathan Bacon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":13575,"username":"Peter_Johnson","name":"Peter Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41173,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"599 The Robodox"},"post_url":"/t/does-sendablechooser-work-with-commandptr/426013/5","custom_user_title":"599 The Robodox","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3141216,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T11:41:32.897Z","cooked":"

Nah, the update won’t fix it. SendableChooser doesn’t work with move-only types, such as CommandPtr.

A few options:

  • (closest to the template): use SendableChooser<Command*>, and store all the options in RobotContainer, passing them as options using CommandPtr.get() (it returns a Command*). The HatchbotInlined example can be used as a reference on how to do this.

  • Use SendableChooser<CommandPtr()>; this will select between factories, and then you call the chosen factory at autoInit and schedule the constructed command. This is likely the preferred option (for Java as well), as it makes it harder to accidentally re-compose the same instances.

  • Use SelectCommand<T> with a SendableChooser<T> as the selector function: T (used as the SelectCommand key type and the SendableChooser value type) can be any type you want. One possible pitfall here is that the options need to be added to both the SelectCommand and SendableChooser, using an enum as T might be able to help prevent mismatches.

We really do need to improve documentation and such on this, and explain the options. I’ve opened an issue: SendableChooser doesn't work with move-only types such as CommandPtr · Issue #5071 · wpilibsuite/allwpilib · GitHub

I implemented the first option and it built successfully! Running it on a dummy board I could swap between the different autos in Shuffleboard. The chassis is being assembled right now so I can’t know for sure that it works but I have high hopes. Thanks for the help!
